items.content:
The subject of this double period (= blokuur) is introducing yourself.

  • Form groups of three or four pupils.

Discuss the following questions in your group (try to use English only):

  • What do you do or say when you meet a person for the first time?
  • What questions do you ask?
  • Have you ever introduced yourself in English?
Step activiteit
activity		 leerdoel
aim		 tijd
time
Introduction Find out what you already know. 10
Step 1 Listening
Introduce yourself.		 You can understand a cartoon about people introducing themselves and answer questions. 10
Step 2 Reading
Introductions		 You can understand a text about people introducing themselves and answer questions. 15
Step 3 Vocabulary You can understand and use vocabulary about introducing yourself 15
Step 4 Grammar
to be		 You can understand and use the verb to be. 15
Step 5 Speaking
Speech card		 You can have a conversation introducing yourself. 10
Step 6 Writing
An email introducing yourself		 You can write an email introducing yourself. 20
Step 7 Evaluation Reflecting on what you have learnt. 5

Introduce yourself
You are going to watch a cartoon in which people introduce themselves and tell what they like, they also ask questions.

  • Watch the cartoon.
  • Listen to the introductions of the people.
  • When you hear a question, stop the video and answer the question.
  • Start the cartoon again and listen to the next person. Stop video and answer the question.

Watch the cartoon again and do the assignment.

prompt.body: How many names did you hear in this cartoon?
How many jobs are mentioned in this cartoon?
How many hobbies are mentioned in this cartoon?
How many questions are asked in this cartoon?

items.content:
Introductions
You are going to read a text about two people introducing themselves.

  • Read the text.
  • Do the assignment.

Introductions
Good morning, I would like to introduce myself. My name is David Johnson and it is nice to meet you. I live in a small village that is close to the city of Cambridge. I am 20 years old. I am studying History at university and work in a shop at the weekends. I have one brother and one sister. They are both older than me. My sister is 26 years old and my brother is 22 years old. They have both graduated from university and work in London.

Good morning. Please let me introduce myself to you. I am Hamid and I come from Pakistan. My home town is Islamabad, the capital city. I am 19 years old and have come to the UK to study English. I will stay here for one year. I want to learn a lot. My family is big. I have 3 brothers and 1 sister. I am the oldest and my sister, the youngest, is 11 years old. My father works as a government official and my mother is a housewife. I want to learn English so I can get a good job. I do not work as I spend all my time studying.

content.body:
Are the following statements true or false?

1. David Johnson lives in Cambridge city. True / False
2. David is studying History at university. True / False
3. Every day David works in a shop. True / False
4. David has a younger brother and sister. True / False
5. David's brother and sister both work in London. True / False
6. Hamid comes from India. True / False
7. Hamid is in England to study History. True / False
8. Hamid will stay in England for one year. True / False
9. Hamid is the youngest child of the family. True / False
10. Hamid needs to learn English to get a good job. True / False

items.content:
Study the words and phrases well.
Leer de woorden en zinnen goed.
If you want, you can also study the vocabulary on Wozzol:
Als je wilt kun je de woordenlijst ook oefenen op Wozzol:

Woordenlijst Introducing yourself hv12
  • Study the vocabulary. (10 minutes)
  • Do the exercise.

Tip!

There are different ways to study vocabulary. Click the red arrow to select another way.
Er zijn verschillende manieren om woordjes en zinnen te leren. Klik op de rode pijl om een andere manier te kiezen.

You can read the words aloud or copy them.
Je kunt de woorden hardop oplezen of overschrijven.

The most important rule is not to study for too long in one go, because you won't learn any more. You will learn more in two 10-minute sessions than in half an hour.
Het belangrijkste is dat je dit niet te lang achter elkaar doet, want dan leer je niets meer. In twee keer 10 minuten leer je meer dan in een half uur.

content.body:
Fill in the correct word (there are two extra words).
Choose from: a housewife - brothers - History - like - name - reading - sisters - to meet - village - years old

  1. Hello, my is Robin.
  2. It is nice you.
  3. I am 13 .
  4. I like books.
  5. What do you to do in your free time?
  6. My family lives in a small .
  7. I have two brothers and three .
  8. My oldest brother is studying in England.

items.content:
'To be' is an irregular verb.
This means that it does not follow the rules regular verbs follow.
To be able to use the verb correctly, you simply have to learn the verb by heart.

Study the section about the verb 'to be'.

Werkwoord To be

Do the following exercises:

prompt.body:
Kies de juiste vorm van het werkwoord 'to be'.
She ..... nice.

Kies de juiste vorm van het werkwoord 'to be'.
I ...... 12 years old.

Kies de juiste vorm van het werkwoord 'to be'.
Kevin ...... 13 years old.

Kies de juiste vorm van het werkwoord 'to be'.
Kevin and Jim ...... brothers.

Kies de juiste vorm van het werkwoord 'to be'.
They ...... my friends.

Kies de juiste vorm van het werkwoord 'to be'.
Robin and his friend ..... at school.

Kies de juiste vorm van het werkwoord 'to be'.
I ...... a good swimmer.

Kies de juiste vorm van het werkwoord 'to be'.
Sam and Sarah ...... cousins.

Kies de juiste vorm van het werkwoord 'to be'.
Jim ..... a good singer.

Kies de juiste vorm van het werkwoord 'to be'.
They ...... good dancers.

Wat is de juiste vorm van het werkwoord `to be´in de volgende zin?
I ... a girl.

Wat is de juiste vorm van het werkwoord `to be´in de volgende zin?
My father ... at work.

Wat is de juiste vorm van het werkwoord `to be´in de volgende zin?
... Trixi and Susi my cats?

Wat is de juiste vorm van het werkwoord `to be´in de volgende zin?
The hamster ... in the cage.

Wat is de juiste vorm van het werkwoord `to be´in de volgende zin?
I ... a painter.

Wat is de juiste vorm van het werkwoord `to be´in de volgende zin?
My green pencil ... on the floor.

Wat is de juiste vorm van het werkwoord `to be´in de volgende zin?
... Emma and Betty good friends?

Wat is de juiste vorm van het werkwoord `to be´in de volgende zin?
... you from Scotland?

Wat is de juiste vorm van het werkwoord `to be´in de volgende zin?
His sister ... seven years old.

Wat is de juiste vorm van het werkwoord `to be´in de volgende zin?
We ... good dancers.

content.body:
Fill in the correct form of the verb to be.
Pick from: Am - Are - Is (Do not use the contracted forms!)

Peter Baker from Manchester.
Jack and Peter from London?
London and Manchester cities in the UK.
Sandra at school today.

Fill in the correct form of the verb to be.
Pick from: Am - Are - Is (Do not use the contracted forms!)

Jack and Peter her friends.
They in the same class.
Their teacher sick today.
Tomorrow it is Saturday so then they free.

Fill in the correct form of the verb to be.
Pick from: Am - Are - Is (Do not use the contracted forms!)

Lucy and Amy British?
they best friends?
their teacher sick today?
the car mine?

items.content:
Conversation
Expressions: If you need some extra help, go to your StudioWozzol account and take another look at the chunks.
Now you are going to try to have a conversation with someone else.

  1. Find someone to work with and use the schedule at the end of this page.
  2. Write down a couple of words to help you during the conversation.
  3. Practise your conversation at least twice.

After practising twice, do the following things:

  1. Find another pair to work with.
  2. Act out your conversation.
  3. Let them write down feedback for you.
  4. Let them do the conversation and write down your feedback for them.
  5. Discuss what things were good and what you can do better next time.
    Persoon A Persoon B
    1 Groet. 1 Groet terug.
    2 Vraag waar de ander van droomt. 2 Geef antwoord.
    3 Vraag waar de droom van je gesprekspartner over gaat. 3 Geef antwoord.
    Vraag nu waar je gesprekspartner over droomt.
    4 Geef antwoord.
    Vraag om meer informatie.    		 4 Geef antwoord.
    Vraag ook aan de ander om meer informatie.
    5 Geef antwoord. 5 Stel een zelfbedachte vraag.
    6 Geef antwoord.
    Stel ook een zelf bedachte vraag.    		 6 Geef antwoord.
    7 Beëindig het gesprek. 7 Reageer en sluit af.

An email introducing yourself.
You are going to write an email to your new pen pal from London.
What should be written in your mail?

  • Say hello to your new pen pal (think of a name).
  • Write what your name is.
  • Tell where you come from.
  • Give information about your family, parents, brothers or sisters.
  • Tell something about your hobbies.
  • Ask about his or her hobbies.
  • End your e-mail.

What have you learnt in this double period?
Answer the following questions:

  • What was the easiest part of this lesson?
  • What did you already know?
  • What was the most difficult part?
  • What was new to you in this lesson?
  • What do you have to ask your teacher?
